description:
Medieval European Nobility was obsessed with Lineage. They created a
Heraldic System to track families, which assigned each family a unique
Coat of Arms.

Any painting of the Coat of Arms was not the official version. The
official version was a "Blazon" - a precise, terse description in
heraldic language. This heraldic language reads like English, Latin,
French, and XML had a baby. It's a fully recursive language with a
formal grammar, variable assignment, positional arguments, and also,
Lions, Bears, and Pythons.

Here's an example: *Sable, on a fesse or three lions gules*

In this talk, we look at parsing this Medieval *Domain Specific
Language* with Python. Along the way, we'll learn a little history, and
the tools for parsing and writing your own DSL.
title: A Medieval DSL? Parsing Heraldic Blazons with Python!
